description: From sun +‎ belt. Purportedly coined by American politician Sam Rayburn.

entries.meaning: (chiefly US) An area or belt of land that receives a lot of sun; specifically, a zone comprising the southern and western states of the USA where the weather is typically sunny, characterised by an influx of population from the north and often typified as having conservative political views. [from 20th c.]
examples: Anglos to whom I talked in Miami  […]  persisted in the related illusions that the city was small, manageable, prosperous in a predictable broad-based way, southern in a progressive sunbelt way, American, and belonged to them.
